abstract_summ: For early transmission in Wuhan, any infectious case produced as many as four new cases, transmission outside Wuhan was less intense, with reproduction numbers below two.For early transmission in Wuhan, any infectious case produced as many as four new cases, transmission outside Wuhan was less intense, with reproduction numbers below two.During the rapid growth phase of the outbreak the region of Wuhan city acted as a hot spot, generating new cases upon contact, while locally, in other provinces, transmission was low.During the rapid growth phase of the outbreak the region of Wuhan city acted as a hot spot, generating new cases upon contact, while locally, in other provinces, transmission was low.In this study, we compared various types of infection locations in which COVID-19 cases clustered, based on the data from three adjacent provinces in Northeast China.
title_summ: A retrospective analysis of the dynamic transmission routesHow Shenzhen, China avoided widespread community transmission: a potential model for successful prevention and control of COVID-19Strongly Heterogeneous Transmission of COVID-19 in Mainland China: Local and Regional VariationTransmission patterns of COVID-19 in the mainland of China and the efficacy of different control strategies: a data- and model-driven studyA Comparison of Infection Venues of COVID-19 Case Clusters in Northeast ChinaAssociation of Population Migration and Coronavirus Disease 2019 Epidemic ControlStrongly heterogeneous transmission of COVID-19 in mainland China: local and regional variationDistribution of the 2019-nCoV Epidemic and Correlation with Population Emigration from Wuhan, ChinaHow does the outbreak of 2019-nCoV spread in mainland China?
